pullRequest.title: created new condex index settings page
pullRequest.bodyText:
Checklist


 the contributor license agreement is signed
 commit message follows commit guidelines
 screenshots are included showing significant UI changes

Description of change

I'm not really sure about the wording used on this page.  This page looks fairly empty at the moment, but search boosting setting will be added to the page in a separate PR


#1337

commit.message: created new condex index settings page

nodes.bodyText: Not needed - also this is not the official material-ui. I'm not sure what this one is, but it isn't required.
rather than tsrc/components, use ../../components. This could potentially be causing your problem.
I wonder why scalafmt does not fix the indenting.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -173,12 +173,14 @@ object SettingsList {
                                             "page/searchsettings",
                                             searchPrivProvider.isAuthorised)
 
-  val contentIndexingSettings = CoreSettingsPage("searchpage",
-                                                 Searching,
-                                                 "setting.contentindexing.title",
-                                                 "setting.contentindexing.desc",
-                                                 "page/contentindexsettings",
-                                                 searchPrivProvider.isAuthorised)
+  val contentIndexingSettings = CoreSettingsPage(
+    "contentindexing",
+    Searching,

nodes.bodyText: It seems ContentIndexSetting does not get used anywhere. Do we need it ?
searchPageSettingsStrings is not declared in this file or imported.  Was your IDE still happy with this?
Do we need DefaultSortOrderSetting in Content indexing page ?

commit.message: fix some dependencies. makecontent indexing dropdown save values
type fixing, this time it will work for sure

nodes.bodyText: Do you need this change? The only place you're using it is still a string. 🤔

It appears to be the main control in the main ContentIndexSettings.tsx.
I wonder if this should actually be named WedPageIndexSetting. 🤔
Yeah, be good to tidy this up @mrblippy
